docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Squibb Corporation predicts that Capoten, its blood pressure and heart disease drug that is a member of the ACE inhibitor family of pharmaceutical agents, will have worldwide sales this year in excess of $1 billion, about 40 percent of the company's revenues. Only two other drugs, Glaxo's Zantac and SmithKline Beckman's Tagamet, are in the billion-dollar club.

headline.main: Talking Business with Furlaud of Squibb; Betting the Farm On Research

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: When a deranged homeless man went on a murderous rampage through St. Patrick's Cathedral last Wednesday after years of sporadic jailings and hospital treatment, the public turned to the mental health system and asked how such a thing could happen.

headline.main: Slaying in Cathedral Spurs Scrutiny of Mental Health Care
